item.title: 前高盛合伙人为千禧基金获得香港执照
item.description: 香港证券市场监察机构向一家股票资本市场专业对冲基金颁发了另一张执照，同时加强了对所谓大宗交易的审查。【原文：Hong Kong’s securities markets watchdog has granted another license to an equity capital markets specialist hedge fund, even as it tightens scrutiny over so-called block trades.】

item.title: 札幌就房地产业务征求建议后股价大涨
item.description: 日本酿酒商札幌控股有限公司（Sapporo Holdings Ltd.）表示，迫于激进投资者的压力，该公司将征求外部对其房地产业务投资的建议，此后该公司股价大涨。【原文：Sapporo Holdings Ltd. shares surged after the Japanese brewer said it would solicit proposals for external investment in its real estate business following pressure from activist investors.】

item.title: 假日货物提前抵达，洛杉矶港七月吞吐量创纪录
item.description: 由于零售商急于提早进货，洛杉矶港上个月的集装箱吞吐量超过了有记录以来的任何一个七月。【原文：The Port of Los Angeles processed more container units last month than any other July on record, driven by retailers eager to get their holiday goods in early.】

item.title: 新加坡顶级房地产公司盈利情况显示行业逆风
item.description: 新加坡最大的两家房地产公司周三公布的业绩喜忧参半，高利率和全球房地产放缓影响了上半年的业绩。【原文：Two of Singapore’s largest property companies reported a mixed set of results Wednesday, as high interest rates and a global real estate slowdown weighed on performance in the first half.】

item.title: 香港大亨郑家纯期待香港成为第一富人聚集地
item.description: 香港最富有的家族之一的后代表示，随着香港加大力度吸引和留住更多的亿万富翁及其继承人，他预计香港将成为全球家族办公室的首选目的地。【原文：The scion of one of Hong Kong’s richest families said he expects the city to become the world’s top destination for family offices, as it steps up efforts to lure and retain more billionaires and their heirs.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。美国股市连续第四天反弹。华尔街模型显示经济衰退几率上升。星巴克更换首席执行官后大涨。市场动态如下。【原文：Good morning. US stocks rally for a fourth day. Wall Street models flash higher chances of recession. Starbucks surges after replacing CEO. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 行业报告指出美国减少石油库存后石油价格上涨
item.description: 由于一份行业报告指出美国原油库存大幅下降，加上中东紧张局势仍在持续，石油价格在周二下跌超过 2% 后出现上涨。【原文：Oil rose — after falling more than 2% on Tuesday — as an industry report pointed to a sizable drop in US crude stockpiles, with tensions in the Middle East still simmering in the background.】

item.title: 中国科技竞争对手迎头赶上，腾讯回购计划成焦点
item.description: 在本周三公布季度业绩期间，投资者将密切关注腾讯控股有限公司有关回购计划的任何评论，因为其竞争对手正在追赶其支出水平。【原文：Investors will scrutinize any comments from Tencent Holdings Ltd. about its buyback plans during Wednesday’s quarterly results announcement as its competitors catch up with its spending levels.】

item.title: 日本散户投资者推高日元看涨押注，接近创纪录水平
item.description: 尽管日元回吐了过去两周的部分涨幅，但日本散户投资者仍在押注日元将进一步反弹。【原文：Japanese retail investors are betting on a further rally in the yen even as it retraces some of the gains made in the past two weeks.】

item.title: 芯片股上涨，日本股市可能连续第三天上涨
item.description: 由于美国通胀降温的迹象支持了美联储将在下月降息的猜测，日本股市可能会延续上周的历史性反弹。【原文：Japanese stocks may extend their recovery from last week’s historic rout as signs of cooling inflation in the US back speculation the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates next month.】

item.title: 美国通胀数据将再现温和增长，巩固美联储减息预期
item.description: 预测人员预计，美国消费者物价月度报告将显示上月物价再次小幅上涨，这将强化人们对美联储 9 月降息的普遍预期。【原文：Forecasters expect a monthly report on US consumer prices to show another modest increase last month, reinforcing widespread expectations for a Federal Reserve interest-rate cut in September.】

item.title: 中国 4,800 万套未竣工房屋危机恐将长期化
item.description: 据彭博社的一份报告称，中国至少有 4800 万套住房在建设完工之前就已售出，这表明中国的房地产危机不会很快得到解决。【原文：At least 48 million homes in China have been sold before construction has been completed, suggesting the country’s property crisis won’t be resolved anytime soon, according to a report from Bloomberg Intelligence.】

item.title: 越南咖啡生产商从 ESG 基金获得 2500 万美元贷款
item.description: 咖啡和胡椒生产商 Phuc Sinh Corp. 将从 SAIL Investments 总部位于荷兰的 &Green Fund 获得 2500 万美元的贷款。【原文：Coffee and pepper producer Phuc Sinh Corp. will receive a $25 million loan from SAIL Investments’ Netherlands-based &Green Fund.】

item.title: CPI倒计时，亚洲股市将追随美国股市反弹：市场综述
item.description: 在最新的美国通胀数据强化了人们对美联储将于 9 月份开始实施广受期待的宽松货币政策的猜测之后，亚洲股市将追随华尔街的涨势。【原文：Stocks in Asia are set to follow a rally on Wall Street after latest US inflation data reinforced speculation that the Federal Reserve will be able to start its widely anticipated monetary easing in September.】

item.title: 邵逸夫控制的媒体公司称，罗杰斯公司在收购邵逸夫之后变得 "掠夺性 "了
item.description: 据加拿大一家电视公司投诉称，电信公司罗杰斯通信公司（Rogers Communications Inc.【原文：Telecommunications firm Rogers Communications Inc. is abusing its market power following its blockbuster acquisition of Shaw Communications Inc., according to a complaint by a Canadian television company.】

item.title: CPI大考在即，债券交易员有望延续涨势
item.description: 最近经历了一些剧烈波动的债券交易员们正在押注周三关键的通胀报告将带来巨大收益。【原文：Bond traders who’ve endured some dramatic swings lately are betting on big gains heading into Wednesday’s key inflation report.】

item.title: 法官称将审查乔治-魏斯从自己公司获得的报酬
item.description: 一名联邦法官批准了杰富瑞金融集团（Jefferies Financial Group）的请求，要求对 Weiss Multi-Strategy Advisers 在今年早些时候申请破产之前向其创始人乔治-韦斯（George Weiss）和其他高管支付的款项进行外部审查。【原文：A federal judge granted a request by Jefferies Financial Group for an outside review of payments Weiss Multi-Strategy Advisers made to its founder, George Weiss, and other executives before the hedge fund filed bankruptcy earlier this year.】

item.title: 向以科技股为主的大型股基金投入创纪录现金的低价买家
item.description: 随着高歌猛进的科技股继续攀升，投资者又开始向超级大盘股投入数百万美元，摆脱了上周市场崩溃的残余影响。【原文：Investors are back lavishing millions onto megacaps as the high-flying tech stocks resume their climb, shrugging off the vestiges of last week’s market meltdown.】

item.title: 前摩根大通策略师科拉诺维奇离开摩根大通后重新出现在社交媒体上
item.description: 摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase & Co.）前首席市场策略师马尔科-科拉诺维奇（Marko Kolanovic）本周再次出现在社交媒体上，自7月初有报道称他将离开摩根大通后，他于周一和周二首次在LinkedIn和X上发帖。【原文：Former JPMorgan Chase & Co. chief market strategist Marko Kolanovic re-emerged on social media this week, posting on LinkedIn and X on Monday and Tuesday for the first time since reports in early July that he was leaving his role at the bank.】

item.title: 英伟达反弹四天市值增加 4000 亿美元
item.description: 对于英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）的股东们来说，这六周可不好过。历史性的大跌抹去了公司创纪录的市值，随后又经历了四天令人反胃的波动。不过，现在有迹象表明，最糟糕的情况可能已经过去了。【原文：It’s been a rough six weeks for Nvidia Corp. shareholders. A historic dip that erased record market value from the company was followed by a four-day stretch of stomach-churning volatility. Now, though, signs are emerging the worst might be over.】

item.title: 美国对冲基金 Whitebox 支持瓦尔塔新的重组方案
item.description: 据熟悉此事的人士透露，美国对冲基金 Whitebox Advisors 正在支持瓦尔塔股份公司（Varta AG）的重组方案，该方案将允许普通股东提供新的资金，因为这家陷入困境的德国电池制造商正在与贷款方谈判，以削减其债务负担。【原文：US-based hedge fund Whitebox Advisors is backing a restructuring proposal for Varta AG that would allow ordinary shareholders to provide new funds, according to people familiar with the matter, as the struggling German battery-maker negotiates with lenders to cut its debt load.】

item.title: 华尔街拥挤的期权交易在近期股市动荡中幸存下来
item.description: 在股市大跌之后，对冲基金押注平静的热门交易正在重装上阵，尽管一些批评者警告说，这种交易助长了近期的动荡。【原文：A popular hedge-fund trade betting on calm is reloading after the equity selloff, even as some critics warn it helped fuel the recent turmoil.】

item.title: 特朗普媒体价值缩水 30 亿美元，X 回归问题加剧
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周一在 X 频道上的露面是他自己的竞争社交媒体平台遭遇的最新逆风，这使得上个月市值缩水 30 亿美元的该平台雪上加霜。【原文：Donald Trump’s appearance on X Monday was the latest headwind for his own, competing social-media platform, adding to a swoon that’s wiped out $3 billion in market value in the last month.】

item.title: Tilray Brands 正在洽谈收购部分 Molson 标签
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，Tilray Brands 公司即将达成协议，收购酿酒商 Molson Coors Beverage Co.【原文：Tilray Brands Inc. is nearing an agreement to acquire some of the drinks brands of brewer Molson Coors Beverage Co., people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 创纪录的小额贷款破产暂缓令市场欢欣鼓舞
item.description: 由于美国各州和城市资产负债表的强劲，市政破产对免税债券投资者来说正成为遥远的记忆。一些策略师警告说，联邦援助的日落可能会加剧信贷担忧。【原文：Municipal bankruptcies are becoming a distant memory for tax-exempt bond investors thanks to the strength of US state and city balance sheets. Some strategists warn the sunsetting of federal aid may ratchet up credit fears.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利的威尔逊认为股市几乎没有熊市迹象
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）的迈克-威尔逊（Mike Wilson）表示，尽管糟糕的季节性因素和不明朗的经济增长前景可能会在本季度剩余时间内限制美国股市的涨幅，但股市全面溃败的可能性很低。【原文：Chances of a full-fledged stock market rout are low, even though poor seasonality and a murky growth outlook are likely to limit US equity gains through the rest of the quarter, according to Morgan Stanley’s Mike Wilson.】

item.title: 高盛、摩根大通称市场对衰退几率的定价较高
item.description: 在上周短暂引发整个华尔街恐慌的市场漩涡之后，金融市场闪现出经济衰退即将来临的更高可能性。【原文：Financial markets are flashing a higher probability of an oncoming recession in the wake the market maelstrom that briefly sparked fear across Wall Street last week.】

item.title: 第一量子公司闲置的巴拿马矿山附近非法采矿激增
item.description: 一个行业组织警告说，自去年第一量子矿业有限公司（First Quantum Minerals Ltd.）的巴拿马科布雷铜矿（Cobre Panama）暂停运营以来，该矿附近的非法采矿活动急剧增加。【原文：Illegal mining near First Quantum Minerals Ltd.’s Cobre Panama copper mine has soared since the facility suspended operations last year, an industry group warns.】

item.title: 马斯克的 X 公司被判向被解雇的爱尔兰员工支付赔偿金
item.description: 在一起不公平解雇案中，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 X 公司被勒令向其爱尔兰分公司的一名前员工支付赔偿金。【原文：Elon Musk’s X has been ordered to pay compensation to a former staff member of its Irish unit in an unfair dismissal case.】

item.title: 钻石市场低迷，博茨瓦纳寻求更多安特卫普 HB 股份
item.description: 随着钻石市场的低迷，博茨瓦纳正寻求通过谈判获得比利时宝石贸易商 HB Antwerp 公司更多的股份。【原文：Botswana is looking to negotiate a bigger stake in Belgian gem trader HB Antwerp, following a slump in the diamond market.】
